*div1 type="summary"* *p*Archibald Austin to Austin, New York, November 11, 1830. Tornel warns Americans against emigration to Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="11-11-1830"> 11 Nov 1830*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*My Dear friend and *person_mentioned*Cousin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*A private oppy offering to *location_mentioned*New Orleans */location_mentioned*I forward a letter for *person_mentioned*Laurence Remmey*/person_mentioned* which by accident, I omitted sending by the Nelson, which vessel I hope has arrived safe with you by this time, as the winds have been very favorable for her, since her departure— I also send you *person_mentioned*Mr Tornel */person_mentioned*s caution to *person_mentioned*Americans */person_mentioned*not to go to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, which may deter some from going, until the *person_mentioned*Mexican */person_mentioned*Government revoke the Law, to which he alludes, those who do go, I presume will not meet with any difficulty on their arrival there—*/p*
*p*You can tell *person_mentioned*Henry */person_mentioned*that his *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*is now here on a visit to her *person_mentioned*Aunt Thompson*/person_mentioned*s, in very good health, and left her *person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*in good health, she is desirous of going to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, to join him, provided he meets with sufficient incouragement to remain there— remember me to him,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Arch Austin*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*There is a vessel advertised for your *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*and—will probably sail in about a Fortnight—The *person_mentioned*Robert Senior*/person_mentioned* Schooner— *person_mentioned*Mr. Perry*/person_mentioned* sent the cloth for your coat to this *location_mentioned*city*/location_mentioned*, which is now making up, I hope it will be finished in time to go by*person_mentioned* Mr. Treat*/person_mentioned* who leaves this his *person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*tells me about the last of this *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1830">month */date_mentioned*for your *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned**/p* *p* *person_mentioned*Henrys wife*/person_mentioned* told me this *date_mentioned n="11-11-1830">Evening */date_mentioned*she had written a letter to you given it to *person_mentioned*John */person_mentioned*to send by*person_mentioned* Mr Treat*/person_mentioned* who expected to go in the vessel alluded to I proposed her letting me send it with this, but *person_mentioned*John */person_mentioned*was of opinion that it would reach him quicker the other way, I however do not believe it will by some weeks—*/p*
*p*I send you a file of the *location_mentioned*American */location_mentioned*which you will probably find interesting, and to *person_mentioned*Henry */person_mentioned*they must be particularly so altho' we have been deprived of arrivals by a long storm—*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colo S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin Texas.*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
